query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 ‘Per me si va ne la città dolente, 2 per me si va ne l’etterno dolore, 3 per me si va tra la perduta gente.
query.result: 1 Through me one goes into the sorrowful city, 2 through me one goes into the eternal pain, 3 through me one goes among the lost people.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
4 Giustizia mosse il mio alto fattore; 5 fecemi la divina podestate, 6 la somma sapïenza e ’l primo amore.

Please translate each line literally into English.
7 Dinanzi a me non fuor cose create 8 se non etterne, e io etterno duro. 9 Lasciate ogne speranza, voi ch’intrate’.
query.result: 7 Before me were not things created 8 if not eternal, and I eternally endure. 9 Abandon all hope, you who enter.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Queste parole di colore oscuro 11 vid’ ïo scritte al sommo d’una porta; 12 per ch’io: «Maestro, il senso lor m’è duro».

Please translate each line literally into English.
13 Ed elli a me, come persona accorta: 14 «Qui si convien lasciare ogne sospetto; 15 ogne viltà convien che qui sia morta.

Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Noi siam venuti al loco ov’ i’ t’ho detto 17 che tu vedrai le genti dolorose 18 c’hanno perduto il ben de l’intelletto».
query.result: 16 We have come to the place where I have told you 17 that you will see the sorrowful people 18 who have lost the good of the intellect.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 E poi che la sua mano a la mia puose 20 con lieto volto, ond’ io mi confortai, 21 mi mise dentro a le segrete cose.
query.result: 19 And after that his hand to mine he placed 20 with a joyful face, with which I comforted myself, 21 he put me inside the secret things.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Quivi sospiri, pianti e alti guai 23 risonavan per l’aere sanza stelle, 24 per ch’io al cominciar ne lagrimai.
query.result: 22 There sighs, weeping, and high wails 23 resounded through the air without stars, 24 because of which I, at the beginning, wept.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 Diverse lingue, orribili favelle, 26 parole di dolore, accenti d’ira, 27 voci alte e fioche, e suon di man con elle
28 facevano un tumulto, il qual s’aggira 29 sempre in quell’ aura sanza tempo tinta, 30 come la rena quando turbo spira.
query.result:
25 Diverse languages, horrible speeches, 26 words of pain, accents of anger, 27 high and faint voices, and sound of hands with them
28 made a tumult, which circles 29 always in that air without time stained, 30 as the sand when a whirlwind breathes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 E io ch’avea d’error la testa cinta, 32 dissi: «Maestro, che è quel ch’i’ odo? 33 e che gent’ è che par nel duol sì vinta?».
query.result: 31 And I who had my head encircled with error, 32 said: “Master, what is that which I hear? 33 and what people is that which seems in the pain so overcome?”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Ed elli a me: «Questo misero modo 35 tegnon l’anime triste di coloro 36 che visser sanza ’nfamia e sanza lodo.
query.result: 34 And he to me: “This miserable way 35 hold the souls sad of those 36 who lived without infamy and without praise.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 Mischiate sono a quel cattivo coro 38 de li angeli che non furon ribelli 39 né fur fedeli a Dio, ma per sé fuoro.
query.result: 37 Mixed they are with that bad choir 38 of the angels who were not rebellious 39 nor were faithful to God, but were for themselves.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
40 Caccianli i ciel per non esser men belli, 41 né lo profondo inferno li riceve, 42 ch’alcuna gloria i rei avrebber d’elli».
query.result: 40 Drive them out the heavens so as not to be less beautiful, 41 nor does the deep hell receive them, 42 because some glory the guilty would have of them.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
43 E io: «Maestro, che è tanto greve 44 a lor che lamentar li fa sì forte?». 45 Rispuose: «Dicerolti molto breve.
query.result: 43 And I: “Master, what is so heavy 44 to them that makes them lament so strongly?” 45 He responded: “I will tell you very briefly.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 Questi non hanno speranza di morte, 47 e la lor cieca vita è tanto bassa, 48 che ’nvidïosi son d’ogne altra sorte.
query.result: 46 These have no hope of death, 47 and their blind life is so low, 48 that envious they are of every other condition.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Fama di loro il mondo esser non lassa; 50 misericordia e giustizia li sdegna: 51 non ragioniam di lor, ma guarda e passa».

query.result:
52 And I, who looked, saw a banner 53 that turning ran so swiftly, 54 that of every pause it seemed unworthy to me;
55 and behind it came so long a train 56 of people, that I would not have believed 57 that so much death had undone them.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
58 Poscia ch’io v’ebbi alcun riconosciuto, 59 vidi e conobbi l’ombra di colui 60 che fece per viltade il gran rifiuto.
query.result: 58 Afterwards that I had recognized some, 59 I saw and knew the shadow of he 60 who made for cowardice the great refusal.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 Incontanente intesi e certo fui 62 che questa era la setta d’i cattivi, 63 a Dio spiacenti e a’ nemici sui.
query.result: 61 Immediately I understood and was certain 62 that this was the sect of the wicked, 63 displeasing to God and to their enemies.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Questi sciaurati, che mai non fur vivi, 65 erano ignudi e stimolati molto 66 da mosconi e da vespe ch’eran ivi.
query.result: 64 These shaggy ones, who never were living, 65 were naked and greatly stimulated 66 by horseflies and wasps that were there.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
67 Elle rigavan lor di sangue il volto, 68 che, mischiato di lagrime, a’ lor piedi 69 da fastidiosi vermi era ricolto.
query.result: 67 They furrowed their faces with blood, 68 which, mixed with tears, at their feet 69 was collected by troublesome worms.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
70 E poi ch’a riguardar oltre mi diedi, 71 vidi genti a la riva d’un gran fiume; 72 per ch’io dissi: «Maestro, or mi concedi
73 ch’i’ sappia quali sono, e qual costume 74 le fa di trapassar parer sì pronte, 75 com’ i’ discerno per lo fioco lume».
query.result:
70 And then that to look further I gave myself, 71 I saw people at the bank of a great river; 72 for which I said: “Master, now grant to me
73 that I know who they are, and what custom 74 makes them appear so ready to pass over, 75 as I discern them through the faint light.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 Ed elli a me: «Le cose ti fier conte 77 quando noi fermerem li nostri passi 78 su la trista riviera d’Acheronte».
query.result: 76 And he to me: “The things will reveal themselves to you 77 when we will stop our steps 78 on the sad shore of Acheron.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 Allor con li occhi vergognosi e bassi, 80 temendo no ’l mio dir li fosse grave, 81 infino al fiume del parlar mi trassi.
query.result: 79 Then with the eyes ashamed and lowered, 80 fearing no my saying to them was heavy, 81 up to the river of the speaking I drew myself.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
82 Ed ecco verso noi venir per nave 83 un vecchio, bianco per antico pelo, 84 gridando: «Guai a voi, anime prave!
85 Non isperate mai veder lo cielo: 86 i’ vegno per menarvi a l’altra riva 87 ne le tenebre etterne, in caldo e ’n gelo.
query.result:
82 And behold towards us coming by ship 83 an old man, white for ancient hair, 84 shouting: “Woe to you, wicked souls!
85 Do not hope ever to see the sky: 86 I come to lead you to the other shore 87 into the eternal darkness, in heat and in cold.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
88 E tu che se’ costì, anima viva, 89 pàrtiti da cotesti che son morti». 90 Ma poi che vide ch’io non mi partiva,
91 disse: «Per altra via, per altri porti 92 verrai a piaggia, non qui, per passare: 93 più lieve legno convien che ti porti».
query.result:
88 And you who are here, living soul, 89 depart from these who are dead.” 90 But after that he saw that I did not depart,
91 he said: “By another way, by other ports 92 you will come to shore, not here, to pass over: 93 a lighter vessel is needed to carry you.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
94 E ’l duca lui: «Caron, non ti crucciare: 95 vuolsi così colà dove si puote 96 ciò che si vuole, e più non dimandare».
query.result: 94 And the leader to him: “Charon, do not be troubled: 95 it is wished so there where it is possible 96 what one wants, and ask no more.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
97 Quinci fuor quete le lanose gote 98 al nocchier de la livida palude, 99 che ’ntorno a li occhi avea di fiamme rote.
query.result: 97 Then outside were quiet the woolly cheeks 98 to the boatman of the livid marsh, 99 who around the eyes had wheels of flames.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
100 Ma quell’ anime, ch’eran lasse e nude, 101 cangiar colore e dibattero i denti, 102 ratto che ’nteser le parole crude.
query.result: 100 But those souls, who were weary and naked, 101 changed color and gnashed their teeth, 102 quickly that they heard the harsh words.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
103 Bestemmiavano Dio e lor parenti, 104 l’umana spezie e ’l loco e ’l tempo e ’l seme 105 di lor semenza e di lor nascimenti.
query.result: 103 They blasphemed God and their parents, 104 the human species and the place and the time and the seed 105 of their lineage and of their births.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 Poi si ritrasser tutte quante insieme, 107 forte piangendo, a la riva malvagia 108 ch’attende ciascun uom che Dio non teme.
query.result: 106 Then they all drew back together, 107 strongly weeping, to the evil shore 108 that awaits each man who does not fear God.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
109 Caron dimonio, con occhi di bragia 110 loro accennando, tutte le raccoglie; 111 batte col remo qualunque s’adagia.

Please translate each line literally into English.
112 Come d’autunno si levan le foglie 113 l’una appresso de l’altra, fin che ’l ramo 114 vede a la terra tutte le sue spoglie,
115 similemente il mal seme d’Adamo 116 gittansi di quel lito ad una ad una, 117 per cenni come augel per suo richiamo.
query.result:
112 As in autumn the leaves rise 113 one after the other, until the branch 114 sees to the earth all its spoils,
115 similarly the evil seed of Adam 116 are thrown from that bank one by one, 117 by signals as birds for their call.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
118 Così sen vanno su per l’onda bruna, 119 e avanti che sien di là discese, 120 anche di qua nuova schiera s’auna.
query.result: 118 Thus they go up on the dark wave, 119 and before they are descended on the other side, 120 also from here a new crowd joins.

121 “My son,” said the courteous master, 122 those who die in the wrath of God 123 all come together here from every country;
124 and they are ready to cross the river, 125 because divine justice spurs them on, 126 so that the fear is turned into desire.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
127 Quinci non passa mai anima buona; 128 e però, se Caron di te si lagna, 129 ben puoi sapere omai che ’l suo dir suona».

Please translate each line literally into English.
130 Finito questo, la buia campagna 131 tremò sì forte, che de lo spavento 132 la mente di sudore ancor mi bagna.
query.result: 130 Finished this, the dark countryside 131 trembled so strongly, that from the fright 132 my mind is still wet with sweat.

133 The tearful earth gave wind, 134 which flashed a reddish light 135 which overcame all my feeling;
136 and I fell as the man whom sleep seizes.
